decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out, completed and retained in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: ARP/11/2021 Rev B; ARP/2021/16; ARP/2021/17/A
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.
REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s) shall be installed in the flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted,  the applicant shall submit a Tree Protection Plan and Method Statement in accordance with BS5837 in relation to the trees that have a TPO attached to Timbers, Brookshill, Harrow Weald, HA3 6RT,to be approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance to the approved details, and shall thereafter be retained,
 REASON: To protect the TPO's in accordance with policies DM22 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan 2013.
Condition : 6 - During the construction of the development hereby permitted, no building materials, waste materials or machinery shall be stored within 5 metres of the boundary of the adjacent Site of Importance for Nature Conservation. Furthermore, any holes or trenches excavated in the course of constructing the development hereby permitted, shall be securely covered overnight or provided with the means by which any animals falling into them may readily extract themselves.
Reason: In the interests of protecting local biodiversity within and around the adjacent Site of Importance for Nature Conservation in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy DM20 of the Harrow Development Management Local Policies Plan (2013).
Condition : 7 - The development hereby permitted shall be constructed to include the permanent installation of three Schwegler 1FN woodcrete bat boxes (or a similarly durable functional equivalent). The applicant shall ensure these bat boxes are sited in appropriate locations that are roughly south-facing, giving each a slightly different aspect, at heights of above 4.5 metres, distributed amongst one or more suitable trees within the application site. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall thereafter be retained. In the event that any of the bat boxes are damaged beyond practical use, replacement bat boxes shall be installed.
Reason: To provide proportionate biodiversity enhancement and gain, in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework, Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy DM20 of the Harrow Development Management Local Policies Plan (2013).
